REASON: None, really.  Maybe a little flat feeling.
SIDE EFFECTS FOR CAMPRAL: I posted a year ago after being on it 9 days.  I managed to abstain for a full six months, at which time I quit taking the Campral.  I started drinking again within a few weeks.  Though it seemed very subtle at the time, the stuff does work; which is much easier to see in retrospect.  So today I'm starting back on the Campral.

REASON: Maybe a little tired, but taking Lexapro, too
SIDE EFFECTS FOR CAMPRAL: Once I stopped drinking for about 5 days while taking Campral, it worked. Cravings mostly gone. It repairs the prefrontal lobe, which is needed to make good decisions about drinking and drugs. Really, a miracle drug. I highly recommend it to any alcoholics, but you have to not drink for around a week, and give it a chance. It did not help when I took it and still drank!!!

REASON: Lowered libido, weight loss, food tastes different.
SIDE EFFECTS FOR CAMPRAL: 1) Only on day 9, alcohol-free, so I will update.  I had been drinking a 12-pack a night for years.  Seems to help with cravings.  I usually cave after a week or so, so we will see....

REASON: None that were appreciable but I was on a "cocktail" of medications.
SIDE EFFECTS FOR CAMPRAL: I was on campral, depakote and zoloft. The morning and afternoon dose made me sleepy.  Afer rehab I went down to 2 doses a day for around 3 months.  Then didn't feel that it was helping all that much and stopped treatment. Have been sober for almost 3 years but have other mood disorder that I have to medicate.

REASON: None so far, but it's only been a week.

SIDE EFFECTS FOR CAMPRAL: I am on Paxil as well as Campral and the effects may be due to the mix of the drugs.  But I got off after only a week so I may have to find another way to stop my obsession with drinking.
